channel.title: BBC News - World
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Haiti struck by deadly 7.2-magnitude earthquake
item.description: At least 304 people are killed, and many more injured, by the powerful earthquake.

item.title: Afghan conflict: Taliban take Mazar-i-Sharif, government's last northern stronghold
item.description: The militants head for the Afghan capital after capturing the key city of Mazar-i-Sharif.

item.title: Afghan war: Kabul's young women plead for help as Taliban advance
item.description: They feel abandoned by the democratic world they thought they were part of, writes Yalda Hakim.

item.title: Polish law on property stolen by Nazis angers Israel
item.description: A new law will make it harder for people to recover property lost in World War Two.

item.title: Sarah Rainsford on Russia: 'I've been told I can't come back - ever'
item.description: The BBC's Sarah Rainsford, devastated after being told she could not return to Russia, ever.

item.title: Japan rain: Nearly two million residents told to seek shelter
item.description: Some provinces are under evacuation alerts as experts warn of "unprecedented" rainfall.

item.title: Turkey floods: Death toll near Black Sea rises to at least 40
item.description: Flash floods in northern Turkey are the country's second natural disaster this month.

item.title: Zambia election: President claims vote was not free and fair
item.description: Early results show Edgar Lungu, who is seeking a second term, trailing rival Hakainde Hichilema.

item.title: Sri Lankan teenager builds solar-powered tuk-tuk from scraps
item.description: Piranawan, 15, from Sri Lanka spent eight months of his Covid lockdown making his eco-friendly vehicle.

item.title: Australia: New South Wales 'in worst ever Covid situation'
item.description: While case numbers are relatively low, the Australian state's premier has warned of a Covid surge.

item.title: Rahul Gandhi: Twitter restores Congress party member accounts
item.description: Rahul Gandhi and opposition allies had been suspended for sharing photos of a rape victim's parents.

item.title: Nicki Minaj and husband Kenneth Petty sued by sex assault victim
item.description: The woman claims the couple harassed her to try to make her recant accusations against Kenneth Petty.

item.title: Nanci Griffith: Folk and country singer-songwriter dies aged 68
item.description: The Grammy-winning artist was best known for her influential career in folk and country music.

item.title: Afghans living under Taliban lament loss of freedoms
item.description: Afghans in Taliban-controlled provinces describe life under its fundamentalist Islamist rule.

item.title: Myanmar: The woman who jumped to her death while fleeing police
item.description: Wai Wai Myint was among five people who jumped out of a building while fleeing a police raid in Myanmar.

item.title: Climate change: Does Germany produce double the UK's carbon emissions?
item.description: MP John Redwood claims that, on carbon emissions, Germany "puts out twice as much as we do". Is he right?

item.title: Viewpoint: Why Twitter got it wrong in Nigeria
item.description: Complex issues have been raised about policing speech and censoring unpopular voices.

item.title: Afghanistan: How the Taliban gained ground so quickly
item.description: The situation looks bleak for the Afghan government, but there may still be a chance of a stalemate.

item.title: The murderous crime wave sweeping Israel's Arabs
item.description: Many killings often go unsolved, with blame being put on the police.

item.title: Life in a town taken by the Taliban in Afghanistan
item.description: BBC correspondent Secunder Kermani reports from a town in Afghanistan recently taken by the Taliban

item.title: Afghanistan: Journalist Anisa Shaheed refuses to give in to Taliban
item.description: Anisa Shaheed fears women's freedoms will be curbed again if the Taliban come to power.

item.title: Afghanistan in serious danger - President Ghani
item.description: Ashraf Ghani addresses the nation as the Taliban reportedly close in on the Afghan capital, Kabul.

item.title: Afghanistan: Desperation as thousands flee the Taliban
item.description: Yogita Limaye reports from a camp in Kabul where thousands who have been displaced by violence seek refuge.

item.title: Japan floods: Residents rescued as torrential rain threatens homes
item.description: Nearly two million people have been urged to evacuate their homes amid heavy rainfall.

item.title: Virtual reality: 'There's no max, there's no limit!'
item.description: "There's no max, there's no limit" to virtual reality, so is it the future of live music?
